info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 5:46PM CDT until July 03 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN BOURBON, EASTERN CRAWFORD, WESTERN BARTON AND SOUTHWESTERN VERNON COUNTIES... At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across the warned area had moved out of the area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain fell across the warned area. Even though, the heavy rain has ended, runoff from the earlier heavy rainfall could continue into the mid evening hours today. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pittsburg, Fort Scott, Frontenac, Arma, Liberal, Mulberry, Mindenmines and Arcadia. This includes the following low water crossings... East Fork Dry Wood Creek at NW 110th Lane and Dry Wood Creek at Highway K. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
